sect3.title: Overview
sect3.para: Photoshop is a well known image editor. This export dialog allows you to export in Photoshop's native PSD format.
You can export your image in this format when you choose the .psd extension, or explicitly choose Photoshop image as file type in the export dialog.

Some considerations when exporting to a PSD. Not all blending modes can be converted to an exact equivalent between GIMP and Photoshop. For many blending modes, the legacy layer modes are closer to Photoshop's equivalents. However, legacy layer modes do not support setting the composite mode. Photoshop often uses the equivalent of our Clip to Backdrop composite mode. There it is called Blend Clipped Layers as Group. If you want to support that, you should not use legacy layer modes.
